summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to attorney Robert C. Josefsberg, reminding him that victim resources and counseling are available through the FBI case agent for his clients who are victims in the Epstein case. It highlights the ongoing effort to provide support to victims during a stressful time.

persons.name: Robert C. Josefsberg
persons.context: Recipient of the email, addressed as 'Bob', who represents clients who are victims in the Epstein case. The email reminds him of available victim resources for his clients.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: The FBI case agent handling the Epstein case, who can connect victims to counseling and victim services. The agent's name and phone number are redacted in the document.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Sender of the email, from the Southern District of New York, reminding attorney Robert Josefsberg about victim resources and offering availability for any issues that arise.

connections.description: The prosecutor is communicating with attorney Josefsberg regarding victim resources for his clients in the Epstein case.
Josefsberg is advised to have his clients contact the FBI case agent for victim services, indicating a coordination pathway between legal representation and law enforcement support.

events.title: Follow-up on victim resources
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emails attorney Robert Josefsberg to remind him that victim counseling and services are available through the FBI case agent for his clients involved in the Epstein case.

keyFacts: The document is an email dated August 19, 2019, from an Assistant United States Attorney to attorney Robert C. Josefsberg regarding victim resources in the Epstein case.
It confirms that victim counseling and services are available through the FBI case agent, whose contact details are redacted.
The communication highlights ongoing efforts by the prosecution to support victims during a 'complicated and stressful time'.
The email indicates that Robert Josefsberg represents multiple clients who are victims in the Epstein case.
